body:
<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--006a51241073e994b41acfe9ec718e94-->
### Code Coverage
For detailed information about the code coverage, see the [test coverage report](https://corecheck.dev/bitcoin/bitcoin/pulls/29458).
<!--021abf342d371248e50ceaed478a90ca-->
### Reviews
See [the guideline](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#code-review) for information on the review process.
A summary of reviews will appear here.
we don't expect most hex strings to contain spaces so let's fall back to this when we can't parse the string instead
c1 validation can be done sooner
Ideally (when no spaces present) two characters will form a single byte - and when spaces are present, it will be less, so we can avoid reallocation by reserving `str.size() / 2`
nit: `const auto c1{HexDigit(*it)};`
nit: `const auto c2{HexDigit(*it)};`

diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,33 @@
+// Copyright (c) 2009-2024 The Bitcoin Core developers

body: Is it really worth it to change this? preallocation seems fine, given that it buys most of the speedup. However, the other reordering didn't change performance much, did it? Also, with modern compilers I'd be surprised if this made a large difference in any case?

Valid question, that's why I put this change in a separate commit with before/after measurements, resulting in an additional 30% speedup on my machine:
[Before:](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/29458/commits/e467437dea8b78e87ba16af306304c7740d5815c)
```
|           ns/base16 |            base16/s |    err% |     total | benchmark
|--------------------:|--------------------:|--------:|----------:|:----------
|                0.69 |    1,445,181,075.98 |    0.5% |      0.01 | `TryParseHexBenchmark`
|                0.68 |    1,459,941,407.03 |    0.2% |      0.01 | `TryParseHexBenchmark`
|                0.69 |    1,457,349,650.60 |    1.1% |      0.01 | `TryParseHexBenchmark`
```
[After:](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/29458/commits/a37a5b11bfba8e8cd2c5f9e940770b6b844ecedc)
```
|           ns/base16 |            base16/s |    err% |     total | benchmark
|--------------------:|--------------------:|--------:|----------:|:----------
|                0.54 |    1,866,216,380.08 |    0.9% |      0.01 | `TryParseHexBenchmark`
|                0.53 |    1,871,755,872.12 |    0.5% |      0.01 | `TryParseHexBenchmark`
|                0.53 |    1,875,106,332.14 |    0.1% |      0.01 | `TryParseHexBenchmark`
```
Thanks, done
The style is a bit all over the place (I tried to adhere to the previous style), should I add braces everywhere in this method?
I don't think you need braces for a return early though.
I think you changed this copyright notice in the wrong file. I don't think this one should be changed, only the one in the new file `parse_hex.cpp`.
diff_hunk:
@@ -1,5 +1,5 @@
 // Copyright (c) 2009-2010 Satoshi Nakamoto
-// Copyright (c) 2009-2022 The Bitcoin Core developers
+// Copyright (c) 2024- The Bitcoin Core developers

body: Got it, fixed, thanks
diff_hunk:
@@ -1,5 +1,5 @@
 // Copyright (c) 2009-2010 Satoshi Nakamoto
-// Copyright (c) 2009-2022 The Bitcoin Core developers
+// Copyright (c) 2024- The Bitcoin Core developers

body:
Rebased the last commit to keep the history clean. 
hanks for taking the time to review this PR thoroughly, appreciate it.
completely unrelated, but got this warning from the CI
same
Hmm not sure we should have these changes in an unrelated PR. The CI failure was for a whitespace issue in the hex parsing code.
Should I push it as a separate PR or just drop it from here?
Moved it to a separate PR https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/29471
